I found this on "Signal" 7:
http://savannahnow.com/node/303649
Ancient poli=
ce languageSignal 7: Shooting
And this:
http://www.okcscanner.com/index.php=
?option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D13&Itemid=3D32
Signal 7 DOA or dead =
body 

But you said it was "Code" 7?


--- On Tue, 5/12/09, Rj <rasterer@ya=
hoo.com> wrote:

From: Rj <rasterer@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The S=
even - interesting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday=
, May 12, 2009, 6:10 AM











    
            
            


      
=
      While some codes are used differently, many are used the same.
All th=
e 10 code references I've found indicate a 10-7 is an out of service.
Can y=
ou point to a reference that shows a different meaning?

--- On Mon, 5/11/0=
9, Jon <jms480@yahoo. com> wrote:

From: Jon <jms480@yahoo. com>
Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
 .com
Date: Monday, May 11, 2009, 8:17 PM








    
      
      There a=
re general set of 10 codes that recommended and published for people listin=
g to emergency services radio bands as a go by.=A0 Many departments customi=
ze the 10 codes for their department, so from location to location the code=
s don't always mean the same thing.=A0 When multiple departments are workin=
g together Home Land Security recommends that to eliminate possible misunde=
rstandings, 10 codes should not be used.
=A0Regards,
Jon in Texas=A0

From:=
 Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, May 11=
, 2009 8:08:33 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of =
info











    
      
      
Code 7 is either code for being out of s=
ervice (short for 10-7), or a meal break:

http://www.radiolab s.com/police=
- codes.html
http://www.yougetin fo.com/info/ PolCodes. html


--- On Sun, =
5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com> wrote:

From: Misty Dawn
 <bul=
letbabea@
 yahoo.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of =
info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 9:31 PM





=



    
      
      Tonight at work I was talking to a state trooper, ther=
e had been an accident. I asked him if there were any deaths (it was very v=
ery bad) and he said he didnt know so he got on his radio and called in and=
 asked them if it was a 7 at the site. They told him negative, and he told =
me the little boy who was the worst off was still alive. I asked him why di=
d you ask them if it was a 7. He said code 7, I was asking them if they wer=
e dead. So if you ever hear anyone call 7 over the radio that means someone=
s dead.
=A0
Just thought I would pass that on. I find it interesting since =
I know alot of us have heard this before when used to describe who is speak=
ing rather than a name they say seven.
=A0
Misty

    =
